data.text: I looked again and saw a flying scroll.
“What do you see?” asked the angel.

He told me, “This is the curse that is going out to all the world. Anyone who steals will be purged5:3. Or “cut off.” from society, according to one side of the scroll. Anyone who swears lies under oath will be purged from society, according to the other side of the scroll.”5:3. One side of the scroll/other side. This is the commonest understanding of the meaning here, but there are other interpretations.

“I have sent the curse out and it will go into the house of the thief and into the house of the one who swears lies in my name, declares the Lord Almighty. The curse will remain in that house, and will destroy it, both the timbers and the stones.”
Then the angel I had been talking to came over to me and said, “Look. What do you see moving away?”5:5. Or “going forth.”
Then the lead lid was lifted from the barrel and there was a woman sitting inside.
“She represents wickedness,” he said, and pushed her back inside, forcing the lead lid shut.
I looked once more and saw two women flying towards me. Their wings looked like those of a stork. They picked up the barrel and flew away, high into the sky.
“Where are they taking it?” I asked the angel I was talking to.

“They're taking it to the land of Babylon5:11. Literally, “Shinar.” to build a house for it. When the house is ready, the barrel will be placed at its base.”5:11. “At its base.” Some interpret this to mean the woman who represents wickedness will be worshiped, and that the “house” is actually a temple.
